Definition: Simple past tense and past participle of pinion.
The use of unnecessarily wordy and indirect language.
Protection:  a child whose welfare is now under the aegis of the courts.
The monthly flow of blood and cellular debris from the uterus that begins at puberty in women and the females of other primates. In women, menses ceases at menopause. Also called catamenia.
composure, self-possession or imperturbability especially when in a dangerous situation
The act of subsuming.
Self-confident assurance; poise. See Synonyms at confidence.
of the recurrence of a trait reappearing after an absence of one or more generations due to a chance recombination of genes.
Extremely old and antiquated. See Synonyms at old.

To give a sketchy outline of.
A moment of intense excitement; a shudder:  The story's ending arouses a frisson of terror.
An assortment or a medley; a conglomeration: "their special farrago of resentments”  ( William Safire).

An exact copy or reproduction, as of a document.

Neither having nor producing echoes:  an anechoic chamber.
Of or associated with sacred persons or offices; sacerdotal.
Existing or remaining within; inherent:  believed in a God immanent in humans.

Walking about or from place to place; traveling on foot.
A noxious atmosphere or influence: "The family affection, the family expectations, seemed to permeate the atmosphere . . . like a coiling miasma”  ( Louis Auchincloss).

A form of tuberculosis affecting the lymph nodes, especially of the neck, that is most common in children and is usually spread by unpasteurized milk from infected cows. Also called struma.
A sudden change of events or reversal of circumstances, especially in a literary work.

Pleasantly pungent or tart in taste; spicy.
Having jaws that project forward to a marked degree.
Amorous, lustful; feeling sexy.
Of, relating to, or affecting the body, especially as distinguished from a body part, the mind, or the environment; corporeal or physical. See Synonyms at bodily.
One of a pair of vertical posts or pieces that together form the sides of a door, window frame, or fireplace, for example.

Strictly attentive to minute details of form in action or conduct. See Synonyms at meticulous.
The lush greenness of flourishing vegetation.

Feeling regret and sorrow for one's sins or offenses; penitent.

A character or symbol representing an idea or a thing without expressing the pronunciation of a particular word or words for it, as in the traffic sign commonly used for "no parking” or "parking prohibited.” Also called ideograph.
